text.0: dawn on us with prosperity o uṣas daughter of the sky.
text.1: dawn with great glory goddess lady of the light dawn thou with riches bounteous one.
text.2: they bringing steeds and kine boongivers of all wealth have oft sped forth to lighten us.
text.3: o uṣas waken up for me the sounds of joy send us the riches of the great.
text.4: uṣas hath dawned and now shall dawn the goddess driver forth of cars.
text.5: which as she cometh nigh have fixed their thought on her like gloryseekers on the flood.
text.6: here kaṇva chief of kaṇvas race sings forth aloud the glories of the heroes names.
text.7: the princes who o uṣas as thou comest near direct their thoughts to liberal gifts.
text.8: like a good matron uṣas comes carefully tending everything.
text.9: rousing all life she stirs all creatures that have feet and makes the birds of air fly up.
text.10: she sends the busy forth each man to his pursuit delay she knows not as she springs.
text.11: o rich in opulence after thy dawning birds that have flown forth no longer rest.
text.12: this dawn hath yoked her steeds afar beyond the rising of the sun.
text.13: borne on a hundred chariots she auspicious dawn advances on her way to men.
text.14: to meet her glance all living creatures bend them down excellent one she makes the light.
text.15: uṣas the daughter of the sky the opulent shines foes and enmities away.
text.16: shine on us with thy radiant light o uṣas daughter of the sky.
text.17: bringing to us great store of high felicity and beaming on our solemn rites.
text.18: for in thee is each living creatures breath and life when excellent thou dawnest forth.
text.19: borne on thy lofty car o lady of the light hear thou of wondrous wealth our call.
text.20: o uṣas win thyself the strength which among men is wonderful.
text.21: bring thou thereby the pious unto holy rites those who as priests sing praise to thee.
text.22: bring from the firmament o uṣas all the gods that they may drink our soma juice.
text.23: and being what thou art vouchsafe us kine and steeds strength meet for praise and hero might.
text.24: may uṣas whose auspicious rays are seen resplendent round about.
text.25: grant us great riches fair in form of all good things wealth which light labour may attain.
text.26: mighty one whom the Ṛṣis of old time invoked for their protection and their help.
text.27: o uṣas graciously answer our songs of praise with bounty and with brilliant light.
text.28: uṣas as thou with light to day hast opened the twin doors of heaven.
text.29: so grant thou us a dwelling wide and free from foes o goddess give us food with kine.
text.30: bring us to wealth abundant sent in every shape to plentiful refreshing food.
text.31: to allsubduing splendour uṣas mighty one to strength thou rich in spoil and wealth.
